Title: COAS pledges normalcy in polity amid calls for state policing, forest guards
Summary: COAS pledges normalcy in polity amid calls for state policing, forest guards . Lt-Gen. Waidi Shaibu reassured that the Nigerian Army would stem the increasing terrorism in parts of the country .

Title: 2027: Diri, Senators, Asari-Dokubo, APC stakeholders endorse Tinubu
Summary: Members of the All Progressives Congress (APC) in Bayelsa State, under the leadership of Governor Douye Diri, yesterday, endorsed President Tinubu .

Title: A defining moment for Nigeria: Why staying the course matters
Summary: A defining moment for Nigeria: Why staying the course matters . As we enter a new year, the questions that fill our markets, our homes, and our places of work are clear and urgent .

Title: CORAN: Nigeria’s heavy reliance on fuel import, disservice to local refiners
Summary: CORAN: Nigeria’s heavy reliance on fuel import, disservice to local refiners . The Crude Oil Refineries Association of Nigeria (CORAN) has raised the alarm over Nigeria's continued dependence on imported petroleum .

Title: NB collaborates to  empower 1,000 students in Lagos, Ogun, Enugu
Summary: NB collaborates to  empower 1,000 students in Lagos, Ogun, Enugu . Nigerian Breweries Plc has entered a strategic partnership with FATE Foundation .

Title: Police recover suspected military unexploded ordnance in Niger
Summary: The Police Command in Niger has recovered a suspected military unexploded ordnance (UXO) device in Zugurma community, Mashegu Local Government Area of the state .

Title: Nigeria’s oil, gas post gains, miss targets in 2025
Summary: The rig count, an index of measuring activities in the upstream sector, recorded a rise of 63% year-on-year in 2025 . Nigeria’s oil and gas industry recorded a mixed performance marked with improvement in some indices .

Title: Oyo suspends monarch over illegal mining
Summary: Oyo State government suspends the Sobaloju of Ofiki in Atisbo Local Government Area . Jacob Adefabi was suspended over alleged illegal mining activities in the community .

Title: Zenith Bank injects N140m into tech ecosystem with Zecathon 5.0
Summary: Zenith Bank concluded the 2025 edition of its flagship innovation competition, Zecathon 5.0, at the Zenith Tech Fair . The event received thousands of applications and deployed a significant total of N140 million in prizes .

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, January 7, 2026
Summary: The Nigerian Naira maintained a stable yet cautious trajectory against the United States Dollar during early trading hours on Wednesday, January 7, 2026 .

Title: NiMet predicts three-day nationwide haze, sunshine
Summary: Nigerian Meteorological Agency (NiMet) has predicted haze and sunshine from Wednesday to Friday across the country . The agency envisaged sunny and hazy skies over the northern region throughout the forecast period .

Title: Saudi-led coalition claims ‘limited’ strikes against separatists in Yemen
Summary: Yemen's UAE-backed separatists announced a two-year transition to independence January 2, 2026, despite reporting 20 deaths in airstrikes from a Saudi-led coalition trying to roll back their weeks-long offensive across the country's south . Title: ‘Travellers suffer fraud as unprofessionalism persists’
Summary: Chief Executive Officer of RE360 Agent Development Limited, Elisha Olorunda, says Nigeria’s travel industry is grappling with a critical structural gap that continues to expose citizens to fraud, visa denials and financial losses . He said the absence of a structured and professional travel consulting ecosystem has weakened Nigeria's global competitiveness and damaged its

Title: Lagos task force arrests 32 for causing nuisance on highways
Summary: The Lagos State Taskforce has arrested 32 street urchins, popularly known as Omotaku, for allegedly causing public nuisance and obstructing traffic on major highways across the state . The suspects were apprehended during a coordinated enforcement operation carried out on Tuesday across the Island and Mainland .
